intro: Pseudosopubia hildebrandtii, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that thrives in sandy and rocky soils, often found in desert environments. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Pseudosopubia hildebrandtii plays a vital role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
